website_summaries.verdict: A call that will allow you to learn quickly and get the geese flying your way.
pros: Makes great sounds: honk, cluck, moan, and spit
Designed with the beginner in mind
cons: A very satisfying call for a beginner, but might not have the breadth of range that some more experienced hunters will want

customer_reviews.title: Easy call for beginners to call Geese.
customer_reviews.text: I'm no pro but I like the way this call sounds. It breaks without too much effort. My brother, who is by far a more experienced hunter/caller was surprised by how easy this call was to use. He was complaining how hard his call was to get to break and then he tried mine. He got on his phone in the parking lot of the Waterfoul Management Area and bought one on the spot. I can't speak to how well the geese respond to this. I duck hunt and will shoot geese if they come in, but we don't lay out goose decoys. We did not see many geese this year out in the WMA here in Utah.
customer_reviews.author: Brady B. Haws

customer_reviews.title: Good Canadian goose call for beginners
customer_reviews.text: This was the first goose call I got/used. But after watching a few YouTube videos on how to use any goose call I learned super fast. I have called geese in with call and definitly a perfect beginners Canadian goose call.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Sounds good and good value
customer_reviews.text: Tried the Primos and Flambeau call first and returned them. No good. Did not try to disassemble and adjust. Then tried this call and right out of box it is very close to the quality of much more expensive calls. Very realistic and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Mac's Momma

customer_reviews.title: Great value easy to Lear.
customer_reviews.text: Great goose call sounds good and easy to learn and use. Only thing is I find it requires a lot of air and it’s difficult to make raspy
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Devine

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat zinks calls
customer_reviews.text: This call requires a lot of air and is squeaker than I normally like but still calls em right in
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Flurschutz

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure there are better calls, but probably at a much higher price. For the cost, I'm extremely happy with this call.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Knights

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Don’t really care for the sound that comes out of it. Takes a lot of air to break the reed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy downey

customer_reviews.title: Boy am I glad I did
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my flute to a short reed and went with this based on the reviews here. Boy am I glad I did, this is my first short reed goose call and after 3 weeks I can honk, cluck, moan and spit. It's a very easy call to run and doesn't require a huge amount of air.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great affordable quality call
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite calls and very affordable. It does not take much air to use this call. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sound
customer_reviews.text: Decent sound quality. Field tested and it works well enough
customer_reviews.author: Tristin Clark

customer_reviews.title: No Guts.
customer_reviews.text: 1 star only because zero wasn't an option. I was sent a call with no guts in it. Kind of hard to call geese that way. Very dissatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Boat builder.

customer_reviews.title: Great call
customer_reviews.text: I like this call. Easier to use than my buck Gardner Grey Ghost. You can create back pressure easily with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do it!
customer_reviews.text: Best call for the price. Beats my Other goose calls everytime. Sounds great!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: awesome call
customer_reviews.text: great for beginners like me to start on. good price for not breaking the bank if you decide you can’t do it properly
customer_reviews.author: yowtf

customer_reviews.title: Great call for the price
customer_reviews.text: It sounds great, needs very little back pressure to crack over.
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use and a good selection for begginners! Calls in the geese like nothing!! also i reccomend a lanyard with this
customer_reviews.author: 7Yakob7

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great call for the price. Looking forward to using it this coming season
customer_reviews.author: Hank Siemiatkowski

customer_reviews.title: good call
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice call for the money. It is easy to learn. It is nice and lightwieght. I would highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Zack Fisch

customer_reviews.title: Calls
customer_reviews.text: I love this call. I have never had a problem getting geese to come in with the call. I would buy it as a gift for friends.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hutton

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and think it sounds good but I have not ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks good and think it sounds good but I have not had a chance to put it to the test.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Hall

customer_reviews.title: New to Goose Hunting
customer_reviews.text: I have hunted for years, however, I just started waterfowl hunting. This call was the easiest I have tried. I tried several that I either bought or borrowed trying to learn how to use a goose call. This has been the easiest and most realistic sounding I have tried. I would recommend it to anyone. Update - FEB 26, 2013 After using this call all season, it still sounds great! No tuning needed and sounds deep and raspy. No sharp notes.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bowman

customer_reviews.title: Great call for the price
customer_reviews.text: I've bought alot of inexpensive calls. One of the best sounding, easy using calls ever. Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Miodowski

customer_reviews.title: great place to start
customer_reviews.text: there is an army of goose calls on the market to choose from. if you are just starting out into this arena, the power clucker would be a great first call. it doesn't take much air to break over, but it'll get pretty loud if you can force air through it harder. I am not a professional caller...I am just happy to get geese to turn and come over my duck decoys...and this call will do this repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: greatwhite22

customer_reviews.title: Great Call
customer_reviews.text: WOW! I wish this was my first goose call! It is so easy to use! Sounds great 👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hendy
